metadata.name: Veeam Backup Servers Credential Dumping Script Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execution of a PowerShell script that contains calls to the "Veeam.Backup" class, in order to dump stored credentials.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('[credentials]')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('[veeam.backup.common.protectedstorage]::getlocalstring')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('invoke-sqlcmd')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('veeam backup and replication')))

output.summary: Detects execution of a PowerShell script that contains calls to the "Veeam.Backup" class, in order to dump stored credentials.

metadata.objective: False positive: Administrators backup scripts (must be investigated) References: https://www.pwndefend.com/2021/02/15/retrieving-passwords-from-veeam-backup-servers/, https://labs.withsecure.com/publications/fin7-target-veeam-servers
